documentType: household management records and financial documents
summary: This document is a collection of household management notes, a grocery list, bank statements, and a sales contract for a shed purchased by Jeffrey Epstein. It details maintenance tasks for a Palm Beach property, financial transactions for a joint household account, and contact information for staff and service providers. The shed contract is from Ted's Sheds of Lake Worth, dated December 16, 2004.

persons.role: Property owner, bank account holder, shed purchaser
persons.context: Primary account holder for the 'Household Account' at Colonial Bank, purchaser of a shed from Ted's Sheds, and owner of the Palm Beach residence at 358 El Brillo Way.

connections.description: Joint account holders on the Colonial Bank 'Household Account', indicating shared financial management of household expenses.
Co-account holders on the same bank account, suggesting a financial or employment relationship.
Co-account holders on the same bank account.
Epstein is listed with Bella Klein as his accountant, indicating a professional financial management relationship.
The household management notes and contact sheets indicate Maxwell's role in managing staff and household operations at multiple properties.

events.title: Purchase of storage shed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein enters into a contract with Ted's Sheds of Lake Worth to purchase a 'CLASSIC 10W x 10L' shed for $2,608.82, to be delivered to 358 El Brillo Way.

events.title: Grocery list creation
events.description: A detailed grocery list is created, specifying organic products, dairy, meats, and newspapers including the Daily Mail for Ms. Maxwell.

events.title: Bank account activity
events.description: Multiple transactions (deposits, wire transfers, checks) are recorded for the 'JEFFREY E EPSTEIN OR GHISLAINE MAXWELL OR ALFREDO RODRIGUEZ HOUSEHOLD ACCOUNT' at Colonial Bank.

events.title: Bank research request
events.description: A research request is submitted regarding the Epstein/Maxwell/Rodriguez account, referencing checks from December 2005.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
Zorro Ranch, 49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, NM 87056
Ted's Sheds of Lake Worth / Fort Myers, FL
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Alfredo Rodriguez were joint signatories on a Colonial Bank 'Household Account' used for property and living expenses.
A detailed shed purchase contract shows Epstein bought a pink aluminum shed in December 2004 for delivery to his Palm Beach mansion.
Household management notes detail maintenance tasks for 'G. Maxwell's Mercedes' and 'Ms Maxwell's closet', indicating Maxwell's active role in managing the Palm Beach property.
Extensive contact lists include staff, pilots, accountants, and service providers for multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, the US Virgin Islands, Paris, and London.
A grocery list dated May 10, 2004, specifies the 'Daily Mail' newspaper for 'Ms Maxwell', linking her to the residence at that time.
